title: In 2015 NXP merged with Freescale
content: We merged with Freescale because the technologies we each had enhanced the other’s offerings. Our portfolio spans security, automotive, networking, IoT, identity, RF and MCUs.

Combined, NXP and Freescale

have created the

#1 automotive technology provider

We estimate that every car has

at least

100 NXP processors inside



This is critical because, in many ways, the modern automobile is the ultimate IoT end node.

title: NXP chips provide security for 80% of the world's e-passports
description: NXP chips provide security for 80% of the world's e-passports
content:
Our chips provide security for

80% of the world’s e-passports

NXP was also the co-creator of the

Near Field Communication technology that changed the transport market in powerful ways.

Please Welcome

Dr. Whitfield Diffie


Cryptographer, Security Expert and

Turing Award recipient will highlight some of the

key security challenges facing an increasingly connected world.

DR DIFFIE

There is no more important relationship in the world than between humans and machines. And two big pieces are the IoT and Cloud computing.

Dr. Whitfield Diffie


Security needs have changed with time. It's no longer just about providing tactical assistance to get work done. When building products, we now need to think about securing for multiple networks with different crytographic keys. For example, intelligence networks with differing levels of confidentiality.

Dr. Whitfield Diffie


Tailoring key management to device role will help simplify and harden security without a need for a ton of secret keys supplied from other places

content: Secure element technology is core to our deep knowledge of security issues, including banking and government regulations. It’s the foundation of our domain expertise in addressing these challenges.

title: Secure elements at NXP FTF
content:
A secure element is a

tamper-resistant platform…


...in our case a secure microcontroller…capable of securely hosting applications along with their confidential and cryptographic data.

title: Jack Jania at NXP FTF
Gemalto at NXP FTF
content: Gemalto delivers easy-to-use technologies and services to businesses and governments, authenticating identities and protecting data so they stay safe.

NXP and Gemalto

Working together for 20 years to secure contact and contactless payment online and offline

Security in Portability


Tethered identity leverages

products from Gemalto and NXP

like wearables to

bring your identity to the device

...the IoT should interact securely with every device we use on a daily basis. We need to be able to authenticate in milliseconds... all the time. Designing in edge-based security is critical. We need to be designing hardware with offline and cloud authentication capabilities.

Join us for the Future Connectivity Solutions Create, Connect, Control Workshop Series.


Visit http://bit.ly/cccworkshop to register now.

Today, NXP owns over ~1,700 patents for security technology and we continue to develop solutions for encryption, biometrics and secure elements.


These are the underpinnings of our security leadership. But there’s a lot more work to do.

Learn more about Avnet’s Agate LS1021A Gateway and Cellular Connectivity Kit.

http://avnet.me/agate

Our approach to connected solutions is simple: to bring about technology innovations that make our lives simpler, safer and healthier.


This idea finds its ultimate manifestation in cities.

Kinetis Motor Suite

Get your motor up and running in 5 minutes!
Leader in ecological design and urbanism and co-founder at Terreform ONE and ONE Lab.

Mitchell Joachim

Associate Professor at NYU and EGS in Switzerland


TED Senior Fellow

Awarded fellowships with

Moshe Safdie and

Martin Society for Sustainability, MIT

TERREFORM1

Developed vehicles to support the smart city of the future. Proposed vertical gardens and automated systems to harvest greens locally.

Arrow Exclusive! i.MX 6SoloX SCM

40 components integrated into a single device pushing the limit on size and weight of your designs.

Mitchell Joachim and TERREFORM1



Looking at historical approaches, motopia, linear cites, land-focused ideas and futuristic proposals like omnidirectional vehicles, soft vehicles, jet packs and smart grids to control traffic patterns to make the best ideas a reality.

TERREFORM1


Looking at freight and passenger mobility services utilizing omnidirectional capabilities with materials like e-ink or transparent materials that act like a visor for the driver.


Working to build a smart car 86 inches in length that interlocks with other vehicles to save space and uses renewable energy.

Mobile Urban Farm Pod


Sensors tell you the health of plants so you can grow your own food.
The concept of cars sharing information and working together is called Cooperative Intelligent Transportation Systems or C-ITS.
Avnet’s solutions include a complete set of hardware options, a full software stack and complementary services to assist you in taking your vision and getting it to market quickly.

NXP has partnered with Siemens to deploy specialized roadside units into transportation infrastructure.

 

Marcus Welz, CEO of the Mobility Division-Intelligent Traffic Systems, Siemens, U.S. shares how Siemens is working to make our city streets and the vehicles that travel them safer than ever before.
Beyond reducing traffic congestion and its environmental impact, C-ITS can reduce the number of lethal traffic accidents.

U.S. Traffic Doubled in

Past 10 Years


Americans spend ~1 week per year stuck in traffic.


Siemens advanced traffic management systems to help relieve the pain. Pilots in Seattle, WA and Tyler, TX.

90+% of Traffic Signals Aren’t Smart


NXP and Siemens are working together to advance traffic control systems

Siemens and NXP


Cars in the near future will talk to each other and the city infrastructure. They will become information consumers.


Cities like Austin are leading the way in recognizing the impact of vehicle-to-x technologies which is why they are one of the 7 finalists in the smart cities challenge.
title: Siemens and NXP

content: The Austin Fire Department’s Robotics Emergency Deployment team is a pioneer is using drone technology in search, rescue and firefighting efforts.

Technology Use in

Life-Saving Environments


  • Upgraded gear allows firefighters to stay in fires longer to look for victims.
  • Aids ability to communicate with ground teams in live situations.
  • Gathers and stores data like previous experience and incident data for prevention and treatment planning.
Future Electronics’ Advanced Engineering Group provides in-depth engineering services, system design services, technical support & global logistics.

Coitt Kesler, Austin Fire Department

Unmanned arial and land robotics aid firefighters in understanding situations in confined or unreachable spaces. The equipment has to work the 1st time.
Dictum Health’s mission is to simplify access to care. It’s recently FDA approved mobile health tablet provides clinically accurate diagnostics for clinicians, caregivers, and patients alike.

Today with us


Paul Landesman, Ph.D.

Vice President of Quality and Regulatory Affairs Dictum Health

Dictum Health

Medical tablet connects Doctor and Patient

without networking

secure, virtualized networks

title: NXP’s QorIQ networking processors set the standard for performance and security

content:
Our Power Architecture and

ARM-based product portfolio is unmatched in the industry, delivering highly scalable performance-per-watt, from the most power-constrained devices to the highest performing multicore products.

NXP is a one-stop shop for your next IoT product design, where the key components and necessary domain expertise for connectivity, interoperability and, most importantly, security, are under one roof.

Free tours of the 3-story semi-truck parked outside the JW Marriott Austin during NXP FTF!

For more info, visit iot.nxp.com/Americas
The NXP Smarter World Tour semi-trucks in the U.S., Europe and China showcase more than 180 products and interactive demos displaying the best of IoT, ADAS and security.
Can you envision your next product Five Years Out?
90% of the world's traffic accidents are caused by human error
Matt Johnson, Vice President and General Manager, Automotive MCUs and Processors, NXP Semiconductors

Autonomous vehicles must meet the highest in security standards


We take a 3-level approach to securing the full system that includes secure elements for protection of wireless connections, secure strategic networking to protect domain-based gateways and the network, and finally secure processing,

for protection of the ECU.

NXP BlueBox


Our BlueBox: Autonomous Driving Platform is a complete solution across every ADAS need. It's open so you can take the BlueBox and plug it into your PC and start porting you software into the box. And you can take the same silicon from the design and move it to production.

BlueBox in their hands now

in the next 3 years

nearly 90% of internet traffic

will be video content.

NXP is a Leader in

Applications Processing


Our i.MX family of applications processors meets the challenges of video-intensive and HMI applications full on, in many ways going beyond the abilities of human senses.

Visit Arrow for a chance to win 1 of 15 i.MX 7Dual 96 Boards Consumer Edition.

Pedestals 701, 702 and 703.
Our MCU portfolio is the broadest in the industry, addressing requirements for the highest levels of security and the lowest possible power
Our smallest MCU is smaller than the dimple of a golf ball to easily enable designs for the healthcare, wearables and fitness markets, where small form-factor is crucial.
EBV Solutions designed Maren, a new reference design platform for IoT application offerings. Using NXP LPC54102 MCU, Maren is a flexible, hi-performance connected sensorhub.

We offer

connectivity solutions like NFC, which NXP co-invented and introduced.
We offer other popular solutions like Zigbee, Bluetooth Low Energy, Thread and Sub-Gig.
Our Hexiwear development platform, developed in partnership with MicroElectronika, is helping startups and makers turn their IoT ideas into marketable products faster than ever before.
Our new supercharged portfolio spans security, automotive, networking, internet of things, identity, RF and general purpose microcontrollers.
